meanings.definition: Capable of being translated back and forth between two languages.
meanings.sent1: The book was intertranslatable, allowing readers to enjoy it in both English and Spanish.
meanings.sent2: The intertranslatable document was easily understood by speakers of different languages.
meanings.sent3: The intertranslatable menu caused confusion when the waiter tried to explain it in French.
meanings.sent4: Her intertranslatable skills in sign language and spoken English made her a valuable interpreter.
meanings.sent5: The intertranslatable nature of music transcends language barriers, touching hearts worldwide.

meanings.definition: Able to be understood or expressed in multiple languages.
meanings.sent1: The intertranslatable signs at the airport helped travelers find their way.
meanings.sent2: His intertranslatable speech resonated with the diverse audience.
meanings.sent3: The intertranslatable jokes in the comedy show had everyone laughing in different languages.
meanings.sent4: The intertranslatable beauty of the painting captivated art enthusiasts from various cultures.
meanings.sent5: The intertranslatable lyrics of the song connected people from different parts of the world.
